curam.util.cache

Class CacheInvalidationMessage<K>

  • java.lang.Object
    • curam.util.cache.CacheInvalidationMessage<K>
  • Type Parameters:
    K - the cache key
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class CacheInvalidationMessage<K>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class holds the details for a cache invalidation message.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CacheInvalidationMessage(java.lang.String encodedMessage) 
      CacheInvalidationMessage(java.lang.String cacheName, K entryKey)
      Creates an invalidation message that applies to the default cache group.
      CacheInvalidationMessage(java.lang.String cacheGroupName, java.lang.String cacheName, K entryKey)
      Creates an invalidation message that applies to the specified cache group ( cacheGroupName).

    • Constructor Detail

      • CacheInvalidationMessage

        public CacheInvalidationMessage(java.lang.String encodedMessage)
        Parameters:
        encodedMessage - the encoded message as returned by the CacheInvalidationMessage.toString() method

      • CacheInvalidationMessage

        public CacheInvalidationMessage(java.lang.String cacheGroupName,
                                java.lang.String cacheName,
                                K entryKey)
        Creates an invalidation message that applies to the specified cache group ( cacheGroupName). It can be used to invalidate a single cache entry or the entire cache if the entryKey is null.
        Parameters:
        cacheGroupName - the name of the cache group
        cacheName - the name of the cache
        entryKey - the key of the entry to be invalidated - if null the entire cache will be cleared

      • CacheInvalidationMessage

        public CacheInvalidationMessage(java.lang.String cacheName,
                                K entryKey)
        Creates an invalidation message that applies to the default cache group. It can be used to invalidate a single cache entry or the entire cache if the entryKey is null.
        Parameters:
        cacheName - the name of the cache in the default cache group
        entryKey - the key of the entry to be invalidated - if null the entire cache will be cleared
